work.name: Institut Jacques Monod
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Prize
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Detecting ancient positive selection in humans using extended lineage sorting
publications.summary: A method that leverages archaic human genomes to detect older events of positive selection than previously possible.

publications.name: Nuclear DNA from two early Neandertals reveals 80,000 years of genetic continuity in Europe
publications.summary: Genome-wide data from two Neandertals who lived in Europe around 120,000 years ago

publications.name: The evolutionary history of human spindle genes includes back-and-forth gene flow with Neandertals
publications.summary: Identification of a DNA segment in Neandertal genomes inherited from the ancestors or relatives of modern humans
